core.adaptation

Interface IAdaptation<S,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - The type of the source element to adapt.
    T - The type of the target element to obtain.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ITransformation<S,T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAdaptation, AbstractNaryAssociationAdaptation, AbstractRelationshipWithAbstractMembersAdaptation, AggregationToAssociationAdaptation, AssociationClassToConcreteClassAdaptation, AssociationClassWithAbstractMembersAdaptation, AssociationWithAbstractMembersAdaptation, BidirectionalAssociationToUnidirectionalAssociationsAdaptation, CompositionToAssociationAdaptation, DependencyToAssociationAdaptation, DependencyWithAbstractMembersAdaptation, MultipleGeneralizationAdaptation, NaryAssociationMaterializationAdaptation, NaryAssociationToBinaryAssociationsAdaptation, SimpleGeneralizationAdaptation

    public interface IAdaptation<S,T>
extends ITransformation<S,T>
    an IAdaptation generic interface defining an atomic adaptation operation of a source element into a target element.

    This interface provides a generic adaptation operation between model elements conforming to the same metamodel (i.e. intra-metamodel transformation).

    It must be implemented by all concrete atomic metamodeling adaptation classes.
    Author:
    Bachar Rima
    See Also:
    ITransformation

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface core.transformation.ITransformation

        apply, getSource, getTarget, postTransform, preTransform, setSource, setTarget, transform
